properties.areaDesc: Aiken; Richmond; Lincoln; McCormick; Columbia; Saluda; Lexington; Edgefield
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 3 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
At 515 PM EST...National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a
strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Clarks Hill Recreation Area, or
10 miles north of Martinez, moving northeast at 40 mph.

HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph.

IMPACT...expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light, unsecured objects.

Some locations in the path of this storm include...
Aiken, North Augusta, Evans, Batesburg-Leesville, Martinez,
Clearwater, Belvedere, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, Ridge Spring,
Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, Riverwood,
Hamilton Branch State Park, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta
National Golf Club, USC Aiken, Saluda County Airport and J. Strom
Thurmond Dam.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 190 and 201.
Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 38.
Interstate 520 in Georgia near mile marker 1.
Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 19 and 23.

NWSheadline: Strong Thunderstorms Will Impact Portions of north central Richmond...southeastern Lincoln...northeastern Columbia... southwestern Lexington...northern Aiken...southeastern McCormick... Saluda and Edgefield Counties Until 600 PM EST.
